title: HiFi-Stream: Streaming Speech Enhancement with Generative Adversarial Networks
author: Ekaterina Dmitrieva (HSE University), Maksim Kaledin (HSE University)
relevance_why: The focus on speech enhancement using deep learning techniques and GANs aligns closely with Dr. Liu's interests in audio processing and restoration.
background: Developing methods to improve speech quality by removing background noise and reverberation in real-time audio streams.
contribution: This paper introduces HiFi-Stream, an optimized version of the HiFi++ model, achieving a significant reduction in parameters while maintaining audio quality.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous models focused on achieving high quality but were computationally expensive, often requiring significant resources.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by reducing the model size by 3.5 times and computational complexity by 30%, making it feasible for low-resource devices.

key_innovation: Introduces structural modifications including the removal of non-essential components and the implementation of a newly designed MaskNet block to enhance performance without increasing complexity.
real_world_impact: This model offers a practical solution for real-time speech enhancement in mobile and wearable devices, making it more accessible for a variety of applications, including voice recognition systems.
limitations: The authors did not explicitly mention limitations.

new_terms.Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs): **Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)** are a class of machine learning frameworks where two neural networks contest with each other, resulting in the generation of new data that resembles the training data.
new_terms.Streaming Speech Enhancement: **Streaming Speech Enhancement** refers to the real-time processing of audio signals to improve speech clarity and quality as they are being captured.

open_sourcing: The code and model are available on the GitHub repository: https://github.com/KVDmitrieva/source_sep_hifi
